context_evidences: - Thrilled to have my first Sunday puzzle in the Times! This grid features one of my favorite open middles that I've made as it pulls from a variety of subject areas. I had originally tried to make it work in a 15x15 grid, but then decided to expand the grid out to a Sunday-size puzzle with a fun whirlpool shape," McCarty said in the puzzle's section. "Hope you enjoy! correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The design of the crossword puzzle was not intended to offend, but rather follows a common design pattern due to rules around rotational symmetry and black squares. The only intentional part of the puzzle was its symmetry. The creator, Ryan McCarty, has made 22 puzzles for the NYT before this one and this was his first Sunday puzzle. He intended the grid to have a fun whirlpool shape, pulling from a variety of subject areas. 
https://kutv.com/news/nation-world/swastika-shaped-nyt-crossword-puzzle-on-1st-day-of-hanukkah-leads-to-backlash-new-york-times-jewish-jew-nazi-symbol-hitler
https://cbsaustin.com/amp/news/nation-world/swastika-shaped-nyt-crossword-puzzle-on-1st-day-of-hanukkah-leads-to-backlash-new-york-times-jewish-jew-nazi-symbol-hitler
note_1_text: The designer says the intention was a "whirlpool". This pattern sometimes arises due to symmetry rules in the game.    https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/crossword-puzzle-swastika-new-york-times/    NYTGames also apologized in 2017 for a different swastika shape.    https://twitter.com/NYTGames/status/924284422106632192
note_2_text: The NYTimes has said that this is not a swastika and they never would intend to create one in a crossword puzzle.    https://twitter.com/NYTGames/status/924284422106632192?s=20&t=_3qsuU6xZXDQDYRoc2YMVQ

tweet_category: Human Rights, Social Issues, and Activism
tweet_image2text: A screenshot of The New York Times crossword puzzle for Sunday, December 18, 2022. The puzzle was created by Ryan McCarty and edited by Will Shortz. The clues include a variety of topics, such as "Style of column at 12 ACROSS", "Berlin's Brandenburg Gate", and "2017 chart-topping overseas hit whose YouTube video was the first to reach 3 billion views".
tweet_text: .@NYTimes Last straw. On the first night of Hanukkah?! I’m done with you. It’s incredible difficult to see this as an accident—if so, there’s an editor to be fired alongside the puzzle maker. https://t.co/DoptfHmJIp
user_description: “Have a heart that never hardens, a temper that never tires & a touch that never hurts” -C Dickens #DemCast #ProtectDemocracy #BLM #WomensRights #LGBTQAlly
